Package ch.idsia.crema.search

Interface ISearch<M,​S>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSearch, Greedy, GreedyWithRandomRestart, LocalSearch, RandomWalk
    public interface ISearch<M,​S>

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static String MAX_ITER  
      static String MAX_TIME  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addProgressListener​(ProgressListener listener)
      Add a listener that will be informed about progresses done by the searcher.
      S best()
      Returns the best solution found up to this moment.
      void initialize​(S initial, Map<String,​Object> init)
      Prepare the search with the specified starting solution and search conditions.
      double run()
      keep calling step until return value is true or some other halting criteria is met.
      void setNeighbourhoodFunction​(NeighbourhoodFunction<M,​S> obj)
      This method set the neighbourhood function that the search algorithm should use.
      void setObjectiveFunction​(ObjectiveFunction<M,​S> obj)
      This method tells the search algorithm about the objective function to be used to evaluate a move on a solution.
      void setStop​(AtomicBoolean stop)
      Set the atomic boolean to be used to notify the searcher that we want to stop.

    • Method Detail

      • addProgressListener

        void addProgressListener​(ProgressListener listener)
        Add a listener that will be informed about progresses done by the searcher. There is no guarantee that any event is emitted except by the ending event. TODO use this also to notify improvements about the actual results improvements.
        Parameters:
        listener -

      • setStop

        void setStop​(AtomicBoolean stop)
        Set the atomic boolean to be used to notify the searcher that we want to stop. TODO change in stop() and push the event from the Algorithm into the searcher.
        Parameters:
        stop -

      • setObjectiveFunction

        void setObjectiveFunction​(ObjectiveFunction<M,​S> obj)
        This method tells the search algorithm about the objective function to be used to evaluate a move on a solution. Must be called before the initialization or the initialize(Object, Map) might fail.
        Parameters:
        obj - the objective function

      • setNeighbourhoodFunction

        void setNeighbourhoodFunction​(NeighbourhoodFunction<M,​S> obj)
        This method set the neighbourhood function that the search algorithm should use. Some more complex search algorithms might integrate the neighbourhood into themselves ignoring this method.

        TODO is this the case? should we have a way to tell the caller?

        Parameters:
        obj -

      • initialize

        void initialize​(S initial,
                Map<String,​Object> init)
        Prepare the search with the specified starting solution and search conditions.
        Parameters:
        initial -

      • best

        S best()
        Returns the best solution found up to this moment. If AbstractSearch.step() did not return false the best solution might change after a further call to step. On the other hand when step did return false, best must return the same solution all the time. Changes that will make step continue the search (increase in max iterations)
        Returns:

      • run

        double run()
    throws InterruptedException
        keep calling step until return value is true or some other halting criteria is met.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
